  917: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  918: unexpectedfun_option_server(Config) ->
  919:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
  920:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  921: 
  922:     Parent = self(),
  923:     ConnFun = fun(_,_,_) -> Parent ! {connection_pid,self()} end,
  924:     UnexpFun = fun(Msg,Peer) ->
  925: 		       Parent ! {unexpected,Msg,Peer,self()},
  926: 		       skip
  927: 	       end,
  928: 
  929:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  930: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  931: 					     {password, "morot"},
  932: 					     {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
  933: 					     {connectfun, ConnFun},
  934: 					     {unexpectedfun, UnexpFun}]),
  935:     _ConnectionRef =
  936: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  937: 					  {user, "foo"},
  938: 					  {password, "morot"},
  939: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
  940: 					  {user_interaction, false}]),
  941:     receive
  942: 	{connection_pid,Server} ->
  943: 	    %% Beware, implementation knowledge:
  944: 	    Server ! unexpected_message,
  945: 	    receive
  946: 		{unexpected, unexpected_message, {{_,_,_,_},_}, _} -> ok;
  947: 		{unexpected, unexpected_message, Peer, _} -> ct:fail("Bad peer ~p",[Peer]);
  948: 		M = {unexpected, _, _, _} -> ct:fail("Bad msg ~p",[M])
  949: 	    after 3000 ->
  950: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  951: 		    {fail,timeout2}
  952: 	    end
  953:     after 3000 ->
  954: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  955: 	    {fail,timeout1}
  956:     end.
  957: 
  958: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  959: unexpectedfun_option_client(Config) ->
  960:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
  961:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  962: 
  963:     Parent = self(),
  964:     UnexpFun = fun(Msg,Peer) -> 
  965: 		       Parent ! {unexpected,Msg,Peer,self()},
  966: 		       skip
  967: 	       end,
  968: 
  969:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  970: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  971: 					     {password, "morot"},
  972: 					     {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  973:     ConnectionRef =
  974: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  975: 					  {user, "foo"},
  976: 					  {password, "morot"},
  977: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
  978: 					  {user_interaction, false},
  979: 					  {unexpectedfun, UnexpFun}]),
  980:     %% Beware, implementation knowledge:
  981:     ConnectionRef ! unexpected_message,
  982: 
  983:     receive
  984: 	{unexpected, unexpected_message, {{_,_,_,_},_}, ConnectionRef} ->
  985: 	    ok;
  986: 	{unexpected, unexpected_message, Peer, ConnectionRef} ->
  987: 	    ct:fail("Bad peer ~p",[Peer]);
  988: 	M = {unexpected, _, _, _} ->
  989: 	    ct:fail("Bad msg ~p",[M])
  990:     after 3000 ->
  991: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  992: 	    {fail,timeout}
  993:     end.
  994: 
  995: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  996: hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config) ->
  997:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, old).
  998: 
  999: hostkey_fingerprint_check_md5(Config) ->
 1000:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, md5).
 1001: 
 1002: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha(Config) ->
 1003:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha).
 1004: 
 1005: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha256(Config) ->
 1006:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha256).
 1007: 
 1008: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha384(Config) ->
 1009:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha384).
 1010: 
 1011: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha512(Config) ->
 1012:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha512).
 1013: 
 1014: hostkey_fingerprint_check_list(Config) ->
 1015:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, [sha,md5,sha256]).
 1016: 
 1017: %%%----
 1018: do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg) ->
 1019:     case supported_hash(HashAlg) of
 1020: 	true ->
 1021: 	    really_do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg);
 1022: 	false when HashAlg == old ->
 1023: 	    {skip,{unsupported_hash,md5}};% Happen to know that ssh:hostkey_fingerprint/1 uses md5...
 1024: 	false ->
 1025: 	    {skip,{unsupported_hash,HashAlg}}
 1026:     end.
 1027: 
 1028: supported_hash(old) ->
 1029:     supported_hash(md5); % Happen to know that ssh:hostkey_fingerprint/1 uses md5...
 1030: supported_hash(HashAlg) ->
 1031:     Hs = if is_atom(HashAlg) -> [HashAlg];
 1032:             is_list(HashAlg) -> HashAlg
 1033:          end,
 1034:     [] == (Hs -- proplists:get_value(hashs, crypto:supports(), [])).
 1035: 
 1036: 
 1037: really_do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg) ->
 1038:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1039:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1040: 
 1041:     %% All host key fingerprints.  Trust that public_key has checked the hostkey_fingerprint
 1042:     %% function since that function is used by the ssh client...
 1043:     FPs0 = [case HashAlg of
 1044: 	       old -> ssh:hostkey_fingerprint(Key);
 1045: 	       _ -> ssh:hostkey_fingerprint(HashAlg, Key)
 1046: 	   end
 1047: 	   || FileCandidate <- begin
 1048: 				   {ok,KeyFileCands} = file:list_dir(SysDir),
 1049: 				   KeyFileCands
 1050: 			       end,
 1051: 	      nomatch =/= re:run(FileCandidate, ".*\\.pub", []),
 1052: 	      {Key,_Cmnts} <- begin
 1053: 				  {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(filename:join(SysDir, FileCandidate)),
 1054: 				  try ssh_file:decode(Bin, public_key)
 1055: 				  catch
 1056: 				      _:_ -> []
 1057: 				  end
 1058: 			      end],
 1059:     FPs = if is_atom(HashAlg) -> FPs0;
 1060:              is_list(HashAlg) -> lists:concat(FPs0)
 1061:           end,
 1062:     ct:log("Fingerprints(~p) = ~p",[HashAlg,FPs]),
 1063: 
 1064:     %% Start daemon with the public keys that we got fingerprints from
 1065:     {Pid, Host0, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1066: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1067: 					     {password, "morot"}]),
 1068:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(Host0),
 1069:     FP_check_fun = fun(PeerName, FP) ->
 1070: 			   ct:log("PeerName = ~p, FP = ~p",[PeerName,FP]),
 1071: 			   HostCheck = ssh_test_lib:match_ip(Host, PeerName),
 1072: 			   FPCheck = 
 1073:                                if is_atom(HashAlg) -> lists:member(FP, FPs);
 1074:                                   is_list(HashAlg) -> lists:all(fun(FP1) -> lists:member(FP1,FPs) end,
 1075:                                                                 FP)
 1076:                                end,
 1077: 			   ct:log("check ~p == ~p (~p) and ~n~p~n in ~p (~p)~n",
 1078: 				  [PeerName,Host,HostCheck,FP,FPs,FPCheck]),
 1079: 			   HostCheck andalso FPCheck
 1080: 		   end,
 1081:     
 1082:     ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts,
 1083: 				       case HashAlg of
 1084: 					   old -> FP_check_fun;
 1085: 					   _ -> {HashAlg, FP_check_fun}
 1086: 				       end},
 1087: 				      {user, "foo"},
 1088: 				      {password, "morot"},
 1089: 				      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1090:                                       {save_accepted_host, false}, % Ensure no 'known_hosts' disturbs
 1091: 				      {user_interaction, false}]),
 1092:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1093: 
 1094: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1095: %%% Test connect_timeout option in ssh:connect/4
 1096: ssh_connect_timeout(_Config) ->
 1097:     ConnTimeout = 2000,
 1098:     {error,{faked_transport,connect,TimeoutToTransport}} = 
 1099: 	ssh:connect("localhost", 12345, 
 1100: 		    [{transport,{tcp,?MODULE,tcp_closed}},
 1101:                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1102: 		     {connect_timeout,ConnTimeout}],
 1103: 		    1000),
 1104:     case TimeoutToTransport of
 1105: 	ConnTimeout -> ok;
 1106: 	Other -> 
 1107: 	    ct:log("connect_timeout is ~p but transport received ~p",[ConnTimeout,Other]),
 1108: 	    {fail,"ssh:connect/4 wrong connect_timeout received in transport"}
 1109:     end.
 1110:     
 1111: %% Plugin function for the test above
 1112: connect(_Host, _Port, _Opts, Timeout) ->
 1113:     {error, {faked_transport,connect,Timeout}}.
 1114: 
 1115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1116: %%% Test fourth argument in ssh:connect/4
 1117: ssh_connect_arg4_timeout(_Config) ->
 1118:     Timeout = 1000,
 1119:     Parent = self(),
 1120:     %% start the server
 1121:     Server = spawn(fun() ->
 1122: 			   {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0,[]),
 1123: 			   {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
 1124: 			   Parent ! {port,self(),Port},
 1125: 			   Rsa = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1126: 			   ct:log("Server gen_tcp:accept got ~p",[Rsa]),
 1127: 			   receive after 2*Timeout -> ok end %% let client timeout first
 1128: 		   end),
 1129: 
 1130:     %% Get listening port
 1131:     Port = receive
 1132: 	       {port,Server,ServerPort} -> ServerPort
 1133: 	   after 
 1134: 	       10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1135: 	   end,
 1136: 
 1137:     %% try to connect with a timeout, but "supervise" it
 1138:     Client = spawn(fun() ->
 1139: 			   T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1140: 			   Rc = ssh:connect("localhost",Port,[{save_accepted_host, false}],Timeout),
 1141: 			   ct:log("Client ssh:connect got ~p",[Rc]),
 1142: 			   Parent ! {done,self(),Rc,T0}
 1143: 		   end),
 1144: 
 1145:     %% Wait for client reaction on the connection try:
 1146:     receive
 1147: 	{done, Client, {error,timeout}, T0} ->
 1148: 	    Msp = ms_passed(T0),
 1149: 	    exit(Server,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1150: 	    Low = 0.9*Timeout,
 1151: 	    High =  4.0*Timeout,
 1152: 	    ct:log("Timeout limits: ~.4f - ~.4f ms, timeout "
 1153:                    "was ~.4f ms, expected ~p ms",[Low,High,Msp,Timeout]),
 1154: 	    if
 1155: 		Low<Msp, Msp<High -> ok;
 1156: 		true -> {fail, "timeout not within limits"}
 1157: 	    end;
 1158: 
 1159: 	{done, Client, {error,Other}, _T0} ->
 1160: 	    ct:log("Error message \"~p\" from the client is unexpected.",[{error,Other}]),
 1161: 	    {fail, "Unexpected error message"};
 1162: 
 1163: 	{done, Client, {ok,_Ref}, _T0} ->
 1164: 	    {fail,"ssh-connected ???"}
 1165:     after
 1166: 	5000 ->
 1167: 	    exit(Server,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1168: 	    exit(Client,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1169: 	    {fail, "Didn't timeout"}
 1170:     end.
 1171: 
 1172: %% Help function, elapsed milliseconds since T0
 1173: ms_passed(T0) ->
 1174:     %% OTP 18
 1175:     erlang:convert_time_unit(erlang:monotonic_time() - T0,
 1176: 			     native,
 1177: 			     micro_seconds) / 1000.
 1178: 
 1179: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1180: ssh_daemon_minimal_remote_max_packet_size_option(Config) ->
 1181:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1182:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config), 
 1183:     
 1184:     {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
 1185: 						{user_dir, UserDir},
 1186: 						{user_passwords, [{"vego", "morot"}]},
 1187: 						{failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
 1188: 						{minimal_remote_max_packet_size, 14}]),
 1189:     Conn =
 1190: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1191: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
 1192: 					  {user_interaction, false},
 1193: 					  {user, "vego"},
 1194: 					  {password, "morot"}]),
 1195: 
 1196:     %% Try the limits of the minimal_remote_max_packet_size:
 1197:     {ok, _ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(Conn, 100, 14, infinity),
 1198:     {open_error,_,"Maximum packet size below 14 not supported",_} = 
 1199: 	ssh_connection:session_channel(Conn, 100, 13, infinity),
 1200: 
 1201:     ssh:close(Conn),
 1202:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server).
 1203:     
 1204: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1205: %% This test try every algorithm by connecting to an Erlang server
 1206: id_string_no_opt_client(Config) ->
 1207:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1208:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1209:     receive
 1210: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Erlang/"++Vsn} ->
 1211: 	    true = expected_ssh_vsn(Vsn);
 1212: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1213: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1214:     after 5000 ->
 1215: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1216:     end.
 1217: 
 1218: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1219: id_string_own_string_client(Config) ->
 1220:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1221:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,"Pelle"},
 1222:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}
 1223:                                                ], 1000),
 1224:     receive
 1225: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Pelle\r\n"} ->
 1226: 	    ok;
 1227: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1228: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1229:     after 5000 ->
 1230: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1231:     end.
 1232: 
 1233: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1234: id_string_own_string_client_trail_space(Config) ->
 1235:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1236:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,"Pelle "},
 1237:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1238:     receive
 1239: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Pelle \r\n"} ->
 1240: 	    ok;
 1241: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1242: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1243:     after 5000 ->
 1244: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1245:     end.
 1246: 
 1247: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1248: id_string_random_client(Config) ->
 1249:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1250:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,random},
 1251:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1252:     receive
 1253: 	{id,Server,Id="SSH-2.0-Erlang"++_} ->
 1254: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Id]);
 1255: 	{id,Server,Rnd="SSH-2.0-"++ID} when 4=<length(ID),length(ID)=<7 -> %% Add 2 for CRLF
 1256: 	    ct:log("Got correct ~s",[Rnd]);
 1257: 	{id,Server,Id} ->
 1258: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Id])
 1259:     after 5000 ->
 1260: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1261:     end.
 1262: 
 1263: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1264: id_string_no_opt_server(Config) ->
 1265:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, []),
 1266:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1267:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Erlang/"++Vsn} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000),
 1268:     true = expected_ssh_vsn(Vsn).
 1269: 
 1270: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1271: id_string_own_string_server(Config) ->
 1272:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,"Olle"}]),
 1273:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1274:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Olle\r\n"} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000).
 1275: 
 1276: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1277: id_string_own_string_server_trail_space(Config) ->
 1278:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,"Olle "}]),
 1279:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1280:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Olle \r\n"} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000).
 1281: 
 1282: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1283: id_string_random_server(Config) ->
 1284:     %% Check undocumented format of id_string. First a bad variant:
 1285:     {error,{eoptions,_}} = ssh:daemon(0, [{id_string,{random,8,6}}]),
 1286:     %% And then a correct one:
 1287:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,{random,6,8}}]),
 1288:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1289:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-"++Rnd} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000),
 1290:     case Rnd of
 1291: 	"Erlang"++_ -> ct:log("Id=~p",[Rnd]),
 1292: 		       {fail,got_default_id};
 1293: 	"Olle\r\n" -> {fail,got_previous_tests_value};
 1294: 	_ when 8=<length(Rnd),length(Rnd)=<10 -> %% Add 2 for CRLF
 1295: 	    ct:log("Got correct ~s",[Rnd]);
 1296: 	_ ->
 1297:             ct:log("Got wrong sized ~s.",[Rnd]),
 1298:             {fail,got_wrong_size}
 1299:     end.
 1300: 
 1301: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1302: ssh_connect_negtimeout_parallel(Config) -> ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config,true).
 1303: ssh_connect_negtimeout_sequential(Config) -> ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config,false).
 1304:     
 1305: ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config, Parallel) ->
 1306:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1307:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1308:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1309:     NegTimeOut = 2000,				% ms
 1310:     ct:log("Parallel: ~p",[Parallel]),
 1311: 
 1312:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},{user_dir, UserDir},
 1313:                                                {parallel_login, Parallel},
 1314:                                                {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1315:                                                {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1316: 
 1317:     {ok,Socket} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1318: 
 1319:     Factor = 2,
 1320:     ct:log("And now sleeping ~p*NegTimeOut (~p ms)...", [Factor, round(Factor * NegTimeOut)]),
 1321:     ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1322:     
 1323:     case inet:sockname(Socket) of
 1324: 	{ok,_} -> 
 1325: 	    %% Give it another chance...
 1326: 	    ct:log("Sleep more...",[]),
 1327: 	    ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1328: 	    case inet:sockname(Socket) of
 1329: 		{ok,_} -> ct:fail("Socket not closed");
 1330: 		{error,_} -> ok
 1331: 	    end;
 1332: 	{error,_} -> ok
 1333:     end.
 1334: 
 1335: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1336: %%% Test that ssh connection does not timeout if the connection is established (parallel)
 1337: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected_parallel(Config) ->
 1338:     ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, true).
 1339: 
 1340: %%% Test that ssh connection does not timeout if the connection is established (non-parallel)
 1341: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected_sequential(Config) ->
 1342:     ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, false).
 1343: 
 1344: 
 1345: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, Parallel) ->
 1346:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1347:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1348:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1349:     NegTimeOut = 2000,				% ms
 1350:     ct:log("Parallel: ~p",[Parallel]),
 1351:    
 1352:     {_Pid, _Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},{user_dir, UserDir},
 1353: 					       {parallel_login, Parallel},
 1354: 					       {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1355: 					       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1356:     ct:log("~p Listen ~p:~p",[_Pid,_Host,Port]),
 1357:     ct:sleep(500),
 1358: 
 1359:     IO = ssh_test_lib:start_io_server(),
 1360:     Shell = ssh_test_lib:start_shell(Port, IO, [{user_dir,UserDir}]),
 1361:     receive
 1362: 	Error = {'EXIT', _, _} ->
 1363: 	    ct:log("~p",[Error]),
 1364: 	    ct:fail(no_ssh_connection);  
 1365: 	ErlShellStart ->
 1366: 	    ct:log("---Erlang shell start: ~p~n", [ErlShellStart]),
 1367: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut),
 1368: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut),
 1369: 
 1370: 	    Factor = 2,
 1371: 	    ct:log("And now sleeping ~p*NegTimeOut (~p ms)...", [Factor, round(Factor * NegTimeOut)]),
 1372: 	    ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1373:     
 1374: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut)
 1375:     after 
 1376: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1377:     end,
 1378:     exit(Shell, kill).
 1379: 
 1380: 
 1381: one_shell_op(IO, TimeOut) ->
 1382:     ct:log("One shell op: Waiting for prompter"),
 1383:     receive
 1384: 	ErlPrompt0 -> ct:log("Erlang prompt: ~p~n", [ErlPrompt0])
 1385:     after TimeOut -> ct:fail("Timeout waiting for promter")
 1386:     end,
 1387: 
 1388:     IO ! {input, self(), "2*3*7.\r\n"},
 1389:     receive
 1390: 	Result0 -> ct:log("Result: ~p~n", [Result0])
 1391:     after TimeOut ->  ct:fail("Timeout waiting for result")
 1392:     end.
 1393: 
 1394: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1395: max_log_item_len(Config) ->
 1396:     %% Find a supported algorithm (to be removed from the daemon):
 1397:     {ok, {Type,Alg}} = select_alg( ssh:default_algorithms() ),
 1398: 
 1399:     %% Start a test daemon without support for {Type,Alg}
 1400:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1401:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1402:     {_Pid, Host0, Port} =
 1403:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1404:                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1405:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1406:                              {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1407:                              {modify_algorithms, [{rm, [{Type,[Alg]}]}]},
 1408:                              {max_log_item_len, 10}
 1409:                             ]),
 1410:     Host = ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(Host0),
 1411:     ct:log("~p:~p Listen ~p:~p. Mangled Host = ~p",
 1412:            [?MODULE,?LINE,Host0,Port,Host]),
 1413: 
 1414:     {ok,ReportHandlerPid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
 1415: 
 1416:     %% Connect to it with the {Type,Alg} to force a failure and log entry:
 1417:     {error,_} = R =
 1418:         ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1419:                     [{preferred_algorithms, [{Type,[Alg]}]},
 1420:                      {max_log_item_len, 10},
 1421:                      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1422:                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1423:                      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1424:                      {user_interaction, false},
 1425:                      {user, "carni"},
 1426:                      {password, "meat"}
 1427:                     ]),
 1428: 
 1429:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(ReportHandlerPid),
 1430:     ct:log("~p:~p ssh:connect -> ~p~n~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,R,Reports]),
 1431: 
 1432:     [ok] =
 1433:         lists:usort(
 1434:           [check_skip_part(
 1435:              string:tokens(
 1436:                lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,Args)),
 1437:                " \n"))
 1438:            || {info_msg,_,{_,Fmt,Args}} <- Reports]
 1439:           ).
 1440: 
 1441: 
 1442: check_skip_part(["Disconnect","...","("++_NumSkipped, "bytes","skipped)"]) ->
 1443:     ok;
 1444: check_skip_part([_|T]) ->
 1445:     check_skip_part(T);
 1446: check_skip_part([]) ->
 1447:     error.
 1448: 
 1449: select_alg([{Type,[A,_|_]}|_]) when is_atom(A) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1450: select_alg([{Type,[{Dir,[A,_|_]}, _]}|_]) when is_atom(A), is_atom(Dir) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1451: select_alg([{Type,[_,{Dir,[A,_|_]}]}|_]) when is_atom(A), is_atom(Dir) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1452: select_alg([_|Algs]) -> select_alg(Algs);
 1453: select_alg([]) -> false.
 1454: 
 1455: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1456: max_sessions_ssh_connect_parallel(Config) -> 
 1457:     max_sessions(Config, true, connect_fun(ssh__connect,Config)).
 1458: max_sessions_ssh_connect_sequential(Config) -> 
 1459:     max_sessions(Config, false, connect_fun(ssh__connect,Config)).
 1460: 
 1461: max_sessions_sftp_start_channel_parallel(Config) -> 
 1462:     max_sessions(Config, true, connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, Config)).
 1463: max_sessions_sftp_start_channel_sequential(Config) -> 
 1464:     max_sessions(Config, false, connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, Config)).
 1465: 
 1466: 
 1467: %%%---- helpers:
 1468: connect_fun(ssh__connect, Config) ->
 1469:     fun(Host,Port) ->
 1470: 	    ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, 
 1471: 				 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1472: 				  {user_dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
 1473: 				  {user_interaction, false},
 1474: 				  {user, "carni"},
 1475: 				  {password, "meat"}
 1476: 				 ])
 1477: 	    %% ssh_test_lib returns R when ssh:connect returns {ok,R}
 1478:     end;
 1479: connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, _Config) ->
 1480:     fun(Host,Port) ->
 1481: 	    {ok,_Pid,ConnRef} =
 1482: 		ssh_sftp:start_channel(Host, Port, 
 1483: 				       [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1484:                                         {save_accepted_host, false},
 1485: 					{user, "carni"},
 1486: 					{password, "meat"}
 1487: 				       ]),
 1488: 	    ConnRef
 1489:     end.
 1490: 
 1491: 
 1492: max_sessions(Config, ParallelLogin, Connect0) when is_function(Connect0,2) ->
 1493:     Connect = fun(Host,Port) ->
 1494: 		      R = Connect0(Host,Port),
 1495: 		      ct:log("Connect(~p,~p) -> ~p",[Host,Port,R]),
 1496: 		      R
 1497: 	      end,
 1498:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1499:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1500:     MaxSessions = 5,
 1501:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1502: 					     {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1503: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1504: 					     {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1505: 					     {parallel_login, ParallelLogin},
 1506: 					     {max_sessions, MaxSessions}
 1507: 					    ]),
 1508:     ct:log("~p Listen ~p:~p for max ~p sessions",[Pid,Host,Port,MaxSessions]),
 1509:     try [Connect(Host,Port) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions)]
 1510:     of
 1511: 	Connections ->
 1512: 	    %% Step 1 ok: could set up max_sessions connections
 1513: 	    ct:log("Connections up: ~p",[Connections]),
 1514: 	    [_|_] = Connections,
 1515: 
 1516: 	    %% N w try one more than allowed:
 1517: 	    ct:log("Info Report expected here (if not disabled) ...",[]),
 1518: 	    try Connect(Host,Port)
 1519: 	    of
 1520: 		_ConnectionRef1 ->
 1521: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1522: 		    {fail,"Too many connections accepted"}
 1523: 	    catch
 1524: 		error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1525:                     ct:log("Step 2 ok: could not set up too many connections. Good.",[]),
 1526: 		    %% Now stop one connection and try to open one more
 1527: 		    ok = ssh:close(hd(Connections)),
 1528: 		    try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid)
 1529: 	    end
 1530:     catch
 1531: 	error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1532: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1533: 	    {fail,"Too few connections accepted"}
 1534:     end.
 1535: 
 1536: 
 1537: try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid) ->
 1538:     {ok,Tref} = timer:send_after(30000, timeout_no_connection), % give the supervisors some time...
 1539:     try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, 1). % will take max 3300 ms after 11 tries
 1540: 
 1541: try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, N) ->
 1542:      try Connect(Host,Port)
 1543:      of
 1544: 	 _ConnectionRef1 ->
 1545: 	     timer:cancel(Tref),
 1546:              ct:log("Step 3 ok: could set up one more connection after killing one. That's good.",[]),
 1547: 	     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1548: 	     receive % flush. 
 1549: 		 timeout_no_connection -> ok
 1550: 	     after 0 -> ok
 1551: 	     end
 1552:      catch
 1553: 	 error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1554: 	     %% Could not set up one more connection. Try again until timeout.
 1555: 	     receive
 1556: 		 timeout_no_connection ->
 1557: 		     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1558: 		     {fail,"Does not decrease # active sessions"}
 1559: 	     after N*50 -> % retry after this time
 1560: 		     try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, N+1)
 1561: 	     end
 1562:      end.
 1563: 
 1564: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1565: max_sessions_drops_tcp_connects() ->
 1566:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
 1567: 
 1568: max_sessions_drops_tcp_connects(Config) ->
 1569:     MaxSessions = 20,
 1570:     UseSessions = 2, % Must be =< MaxSessions
 1571:     FloodSessions = 1000,
 1572:     ParallelLogin = true,
 1573:     NegTimeOut = 8*1000,
 1574:     HelloTimeOut = 200,
 1575: 
 1576:     %% Start a test daemon
 1577:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1578:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1579:     {Pid, Host0, Port} =
 1580:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1581:                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1582:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1583:                              {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1584:                              {parallel_login, ParallelLogin},
 1585:                              {hello_timeout, HelloTimeOut},
 1586:                              {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1587:                              {max_sessions, MaxSessions}
 1588:                             ]),
 1589:     Host = ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(Host0),
 1590:     ct:log("~p:~p ~p Listen ~p:~p for max ~p sessions. Mangled Host = ~p",
 1591:            [?MODULE,?LINE,Pid,Host0,Port,MaxSessions,Host]),
 1592:     
 1593:     %% Log in UseSessions connections
 1594:     SSHconnect = fun(N) ->
 1595:                          R = ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1596:                                          [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1597:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1598:                                           {user_dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
 1599:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1600:                                           {user, "carni"},
 1601:                                           {password, "meat"}
 1602:                                          ]),
 1603:                          ct:log("~p:~p ~p: ssh:connect -> ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,N,R]),
 1604:                          R
 1605:                  end,
 1606: 
 1607:     L1 = oks([SSHconnect(N) || N <- lists:seq(1,UseSessions)]),
 1608:     case length(L1) of
 1609:         UseSessions ->
 1610:             %% As expected
 1611:             %% Try gen_tcp:connect
 1612:             [ct:log("~p:~p ~p: gen_tcp:connect -> ~p", 
 1613:                     [?MODULE,?LINE, N, gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [])])
 1614:              || N <- lists:seq(UseSessions+1, MaxSessions)
 1615:             ],
 1616: 
 1617:             ct:log("~p:~p Now try ~p gen_tcp:connect to be rejected", [?MODULE,?LINE,FloodSessions]),
 1618:             [ct:log("~p:~p ~p: gen_tcp:connect -> ~p", 
 1619:                     [?MODULE,?LINE, N, gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [])])
 1620:              || N <- lists:seq(MaxSessions+1, MaxSessions+1+FloodSessions)
 1621:             ],
 1622:             
 1623:             ct:log("~p:~p try ~p ssh:connect", [?MODULE,?LINE, MaxSessions - UseSessions]),
 1624:             try_ssh_connect(MaxSessions - UseSessions, NegTimeOut, SSHconnect);
 1625: 
 1626:         Len1 ->
 1627:             {fail, Len1}
 1628:     end.
 1629: 
 1630: try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F) when N>0 ->
 1631:     case F(N) of
 1632:         {ok,_} ->
 1633:             try_ssh_connect(N-1, NegTimeOut, F);
 1634:         {error,_} when N==1 ->
 1635:             try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F);
 1636:         {error,_} ->
 1637:             timer:sleep(NegTimeOut),
 1638:             try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F)
 1639:     end;
 1640: try_ssh_connect(_N, _NegTimeOut, _F) ->
 1641:     done.
 1642: 
 1643: 
 1644: oks(L) -> lists:filter(fun({ok,_}) -> true;
 1645:                           (_) -> false
 1646:                        end, L).
 1647:     
 1648: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1649: save_accepted_host_option(Config) ->
 1650:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1651:     KnownHosts = filename:join(UserDir, "known_hosts"),
 1652:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),	  
 1653:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1654: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1655: 					     {user_passwords, [{"vego", "morot"}]}
 1656:                                             ]),
 1657:     {error,enoent} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1658: 
 1659:     {ok,_C1} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1660:                                         {save_accepted_host, false},
 1661:                                         {user, "vego"},
 1662:                                         {password, "morot"},
 1663:                                         {user_interaction, false},
 1664:                                         {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1665:     {error,enoent} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1666:     
 1667:     {ok,_C2} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1668:                                         {user, "vego"},
 1669:                                         {password, "morot"},
 1670:                                         {user_interaction, false},
 1671:                                         {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1672:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1673:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1674: 
 1675: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1676: raw_option(_Config) ->
 1677:     Opts = [{raw,1,2,3,4}],
 1678:     #{socket_options := Opts} = ssh_options:handle_options(client, Opts),
 1679:     #{socket_options := Opts} = ssh_options:handle_options(server, Opts).
 1680: 
 1681: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1682: config_file(Config) ->
 1683:     %% First find common algs:
 1684:     ServerAlgs = ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd),
 1685:     OurAlgs = ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(), % Incl disabled but supported
 1686:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:intersection(ServerAlgs, OurAlgs),
 1687:     ct:log("ServerAlgs =~n~p~n~nOurAlgs =~n~p~n~nCommonAlgs =~n~p",[ServerAlgs,OurAlgs,CommonAlgs]),   
 1688:     Nkex = length(proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs, [])),
 1689: 
 1690:     %% Adjust for very old ssh daemons that only supports ssh-rsa and ssh-dss:
 1691:     AdjustClient =
 1692:         case proplists:get_value(public_key,ServerAlgs,[]) -- ['ssh-rsa','ssh-dss'] of
 1693:             [] ->
 1694:                 %% Old, let the client support them also:
 1695:                 ct:log("Adjust the client's public_key set", []),
 1696:                 [{public_key, ['ssh-rsa','ssh-dss']}];
 1697:             [_|_] ->
 1698:                 %% Ok, let the client be un-modified:
 1699:                 []
 1700:         end,
 1701: 
 1702:     case {ServerAlgs, ssh_test_lib:some_empty(CommonAlgs)} of
 1703:         {[],_} ->
 1704:             {skip, "No server algorithms found"};
 1705:         {_,true} ->
 1706:             {fail, "Missing common algorithms"};
 1707:         _ when Nkex<3 ->
 1708:             {skip, "Not enough number of common kex"};
 1709:         _ ->
 1710:             %% Then find three common kex and one common cipher:
 1711:             [K1a,K1b,K2a|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs),
 1712:             [{_,[Ch1|_]}|_] = proplists:get_value(cipher, CommonAlgs),
 1713: 
 1714:             %% Make config file:
 1715:             {ok,ConfFile} = 
 1716:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1717:                   "c2.config", Config,
 1718:                   [{ssh, [{preferred_algorithms,
 1719:                            [{cipher, [Ch1]},
 1720:                             {kex,    [K1a]}
 1721:                            ] ++ AdjustClient},
 1722:                           {client_options,
 1723:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1724:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1a]}]},
 1725:                               {append, [{kex, [K1b]}]}
 1726:                              ]}
 1727:                            ]}
 1728:                          ]}
 1729:                   ]),
 1730: 
 1731:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 1732:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 1733: 
 1734:             R0 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1735:             ct:log("R0 = ~p",[R0]),
 1736:             R0 = ssh:default_algorithms(),
 1737: 
 1738:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 1739:             rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 1740: 
 1741:             R1 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1742:             ct:log("R1 = ~p",[R1]),
 1743:             [{kex,[K1a]},
 1744:              {public_key,_},
 1745:              {cipher,[{_,[Ch1]},
 1746:                       {_,[Ch1]}]} | _] = R1,
 1747: 
 1748:             %% First connection. The client_options should be applied:
 1749:             {ok,C1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connect, [loopback, ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT,
 1750:                                                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1751:                                                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1752:                                                      {user_interaction, false}
 1753:                                                     ]]),
 1754:             ct:log("C1 = ~n~p", [C1]),
 1755:             {algorithms,As1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C1, algorithms]),
 1756:             K1b = proplists:get_value(kex, As1),
 1757:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(encrypt, As1),
 1758:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(decrypt, As1),
 1759:             {options,Os1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C1, options]),
 1760:             ct:log("C1 algorithms:~n~p~n~noptions:~n~p", [As1,Os1]),
 1761: 
 1762:             %% Second connection, the Options take precedence:
 1763:             C2_Opts = [{modify_algorithms,[{rm,[{kex,[K1b]}]}, % N.B.
 1764:                                            {append, [{kex,[K2a]}]}]},
 1765:                        {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1766:                        {save_accepted_host, false},
 1767:                        {user_interaction, false}
 1768:                       ],
 1769:             {ok,C2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connect, [loopback, ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, C2_Opts]),
 1770:             {algorithms,As2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C2, algorithms]),
 1771:             K2a = proplists:get_value(kex, As2),
 1772:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(encrypt, As2),
 1773:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(decrypt, As2),
 1774:             {options,Os2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C2, options]),
 1775:             ct:log("C2 opts:~n~p~n~nalgorithms:~n~p~n~noptions:~n~p", [C2_Opts,As2,Os2]),
 1776: 
 1777:             peer:stop(Peer)
 1778:     end.
 1779:     
 1780: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1781: config_file_modify_algorithms_order(Config) ->
 1782:     %% First find common algs:
 1783:     ServerAlgs = ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd),
 1784:     OurAlgs = ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(), % Incl disabled but supported
 1785:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:intersection(ServerAlgs, OurAlgs),
 1786:     ct:log("ServerAlgs =~n~p~n~nOurAlgs =~n~p~n~nCommonAlgs =~n~p",[ServerAlgs,OurAlgs,CommonAlgs]),
 1787:     Nkex = length(proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs, [])),
 1788:     case {ServerAlgs, ssh_test_lib:some_empty(CommonAlgs)} of
 1789:         {[],_} ->
 1790:             {skip, "No server algorithms found"};
 1791:         {_,true} ->
 1792:             {fail, "Missing common algorithms"};
 1793:         _ when Nkex<3 ->
 1794:             {skip, "Not enough number of common kex"};
 1795:         _ ->
 1796:             %% Then find three common kex and one common cipher:
 1797:             [K1,K2,K3|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs),
 1798:             [{_,[Ch1|_]}|_] = proplists:get_value(cipher, CommonAlgs),
 1799: 
 1800:             %% Make config file:
 1801:             {ok, ConfFile} =
 1802:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1803:                   "c3.config", Config,
 1804:                   [{ssh, [{preferred_algorithms,
 1805:                            [{cipher, [Ch1]},
 1806:                             {kex,    [K1]}
 1807:                            ]},
 1808:                           {server_options,
 1809:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1810:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1]}]},
 1811:                               {append, [{kex, [K2]}]}
 1812:                              ]}
 1813:                            ]},
 1814:                           {client_options,
 1815:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1816:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1]}]},
 1817:                               {append, [{kex, [K3]}]}
 1818:                              ]}
 1819:                            ]}
 1820:                          ]}
 1821:                   ]),
 1822: 
 1823:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 1824:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 1825:     
 1826:             R0 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1827:             ct:log("R0 = ~p",[R0]),
 1828:             R0 = ssh:default_algorithms(),
 1829: 
 1830:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 1831:             ok = rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 1832:             R1 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1833:             ct:log("R1 = ~p",[R1]),
 1834:             [{kex,[K1]} | _] = R1,
 1835: 
 1836:             %% Start a daemon
 1837:             {Server, Host, Port} = rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_daemon, [Config, []]),
 1838:             {ok,ServerInfo} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, daemon_info, [Server]),
 1839:             ct:log("ServerInfo =~n~p", [ServerInfo]),
 1840: 
 1841:             %% Test that the server_options env key works:
 1842:             [K2] = proplists:get_value(kex,
 1843:                    proplists:get_value(preferred_algorithms,
 1844:                    proplists:get_value(options, ServerInfo))),
 1845:             
 1846:             {badrpc, {'EXIT', {{badmatch,ExpectedError}, _}}} =
 1847:                 %% No common kex algorithms expected. 
 1848:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_connect, [Config, Host, Port, []]), 
 1849:             {error,"Key exchange failed"} = ExpectedError,
 1850: 
 1851:             C = rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_connect,
 1852:                          [Config, Host, Port, 
 1853:                           [{modify_algorithms,[{append,[{kex,[K2]}]}]}]]),
 1854:             ConnInfo = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C]),
 1855:             ct:log("ConnInfo =~n~p", [ConnInfo]),
 1856:             Algs = proplists:get_value(algorithms, ConnInfo),
 1857:             ct:log("Algs =~n~p", [Algs]),
 1858:             ConnOptions = proplists:get_value(options, ConnInfo),
 1859:             ConnPrefAlgs = proplists:get_value(preferred_algorithms, ConnOptions),
 1860: 
 1861:             %% And now, are all levels applied in right order:
 1862:             [K3,K2] = proplists:get_value(kex, ConnPrefAlgs),
 1863: 
 1864:             peer:stop(Peer)
 1865:     end.
 1866: 
 1867:     
 1868: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1869: daemon_replace_options_simple(Config) ->
 1870:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1871: 
 1872:     UserDir1 = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1873:     UserDir2 = filename:join(UserDir1, "foo"),
 1874:     file:make_dir(UserDir2),
 1875: 
 1876:     {Pid, _Host, _Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1877:                                                {user_dir, UserDir1}
 1878:                                               ]),
 1879:     {ok,Opts1} = ssh:daemon_info(Pid),
 1880:     UserDir1 = proplists:get_value(user_dir, proplists:get_value(options,Opts1,[])),
 1881: 
 1882:     {ok, Pid} = ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{user_dir,UserDir2}]),
 1883:     {ok,Opts2} = ssh:daemon_info(Pid),
 1884:     case proplists:get_value(user_dir, proplists:get_value(options,Opts2,[])) of
 1885:         UserDir2 ->
 1886:             ok;
 1887:         UserDir1 ->
 1888:             ct:log("~p:~p Got old value ~p~nExpected ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,UserDir1,UserDir2]),
 1889:             {fail, "Not changed"};
 1890:         Other ->
 1891:             ct:log("~p:~p Got ~p~nExpected ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other,UserDir2]),
 1892:             {fail, "Strange value"}
 1893:     end.
 1894: 
 1895: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1896: daemon_replace_options_algs(Config) ->
 1897:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1898:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1899: 
 1900:     DefaultKex =
 1901:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 1902:     NonDefaultKex =
 1903:         ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(kex) -- DefaultKex,
 1904: 
 1905:     case NonDefaultKex of
 1906:         [A1|_] ->
 1907:             [A2,A3|_] = DefaultKex,
 1908:             {Pid, _Host, _Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1909:                                                        {user_dir, UserDir},
 1910:                                                        {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1911:                                                       ]),
 1912:             [A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1913:             {ok, Pid} =
 1914:                 ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{modify_algorithms,
 1915:                                                   [{prepend,[{kex,[A2]}]}]
 1916:                                                  }
 1917:                                                 ]),
 1918:             [A2,A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1919: 
 1920:             {ok, Pid} =
 1921:                 ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A3]}]
 1922:                                                  }
 1923:                                                 ]),
 1924:             [A2,A3] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex)
 1925:             ;
 1926:         [] ->
 1927:             {skip, "No non-default kex"}
 1928:     end.
 1929: 
 1930: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1931: daemon_replace_options_algs_connect(Config) ->
 1932:     [A1,A2|_] =
 1933:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 1934: 
 1935:     {Pid, Host, Port} =
 1936:         ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config,
 1937:                                 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1938:                                 ]),
 1939:     [A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1940: 
 1941:     %% Open a connection with A1 as kex and test it
 1942:     C1 =
 1943:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 1944:                                  [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1945:                                  ]),
 1946:     ok = test_connection(C1),
 1947:     ok = test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 1948:                           [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}
 1949:                           ]),
 1950: 
 1951:     %% Change kex to A2
 1952:     {ok, Pid} =
 1953:         ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid,
 1954:                                    [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}]),
 1955:     [A2] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1956: 
 1957:     %% and open the second connection with this kex, and test it
 1958:     C2 =
 1959:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 1960:                                  [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}
 1961:                                  ]),
 1962:     ok = test_connection(C2),
 1963:     ok = test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 1964:                           [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1965:                           ]),
 1966: 
 1967:     %% Test that the first connection is still alive:
 1968:     ok = test_connection(C1),
 1969: 
 1970:     ssh:close(C1),
 1971:     ssh:close(C2),
 1972:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1973: 
 1974: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1975: daemon_replace_options_algs_conf_file(Config) ->
 1976:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1977:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1978: 
 1979:     DefaultKex =
 1980:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 1981:     NonDefaultKex =
 1982:         ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(kex) -- DefaultKex,
 1983: 
 1984:     case NonDefaultKex of
 1985:         [A0,A1|_] ->
 1986:             %% Make config file:
 1987:             {ok,ConfFile} =
 1988:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1989:                   "c4.config", Config,
 1990:                   [{ssh, [{modify_algorithms,
 1991:                            %% Whatever happens, always put A0 first in the kex list:
 1992:                            [{prepend, [{kex, [A0]}]}
 1993:                            ]}
 1994:                          ]}
 1995:                   ]),
 1996: 
 1997:             [A2|_] = DefaultKex,
 1998:             ct:log("[A0, A1, A2] = ~p", [[A0, A1, A2]]),
 1999: 
 2000:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 2001:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 2002: 
 2003:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 2004:             rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 2005: 
 2006:             {Pid, _Host, _Port} =
 2007:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, daemon,
 2008:                          [
 2009:                           [{system_dir, SysDir},
 2010:                            {user_dir, UserDir},
 2011:                            {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2012:                           ]
 2013:                          ]),
 2014: 
 2015:             [A0,A1] =
 2016:                 rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, get_preferred_algorithms, [Pid, kex]),
 2017:             {ok, Pid} =
 2018:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh, daemon_replace_options,
 2019:                          [Pid,
 2020:                           [{modify_algorithms,
 2021:                             [{prepend,[{kex,[A2]}]}]
 2022:                            }
 2023:                           ]
 2024:                          ]),
 2025: 
 2026:             %% Check that the precedens order is fulfilled:
 2027:             [A2,A0,A1] =
 2028:                 rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, get_preferred_algorithms, [Pid, kex]),
 2029: 
 2030:             peer:stop(Peer);
 2031:         [] ->
 2032:             {skip, "No non-default kex"}
 2033:     end.
 2034: 
 2035: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2036: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 2037: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2038: 
 2039: expected_ssh_vsn(Str) ->
 2040:     try
 2041: 	{ok,L} = application:get_all_key(ssh),
 2042: 	proplists:get_value(vsn,L,"")++"\r\n"
 2043:     of
 2044: 	Str -> true;
 2045: 	"\r\n" -> true;
 2046: 	_ -> false
 2047:     catch
 2048: 	_:_ -> true %% ssh not started so we don't know
 2049:     end.
 2050: 	    
 2051: 
 2052: fake_daemon(_Config) ->
 2053:     Parent = self(),
 2054:     %% start the server
 2055:     Server = spawn(fun() ->
 2056: 			   {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0,[{packet,line}]),
 2057: 			   {ok,{Host,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
 2058: 			   ct:log("fake_daemon listening on ~p:~p~n",[Host,Port]),
 2059: 			   Parent ! {sockname,self(),Host,Port},
 2060: 			   Rsa = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 2061: 			   ct:log("Server gen_tcp:accept got ~p",[Rsa]),
 2062: 			   {ok,S} = Rsa,
 2063: 			   receive
 2064: 			       {tcp, S, Id} -> Parent ! {id,self(),Id}
 2065: 			   after 
 2066: 			       10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2067: 			   end
 2068: 		   end),
 2069:     %% Get listening host and port
 2070:     receive
 2071: 	{sockname,Server,ServerHost,ServerPort} -> {Server, ServerHost, ServerPort}
 2072:     after 
 2073: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2074:     end.
 2075: 
 2076: 
 2077: make_config_file_in_privdir(FileName, Config, Contents) ->
 2078:     %% write the file:
 2079:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2080:     ConfFile = filename:join(PrivDir, FileName),
 2081:     {ok,D} = file:open(ConfFile, [write]),
 2082:     io:format(D, "~p.~n", [Contents]),
 2083:     file:close(D),
 2084:     {ok,Cnfs} = file:read_file(ConfFile),
 2085:     ct:log("Config file ~p :~n~s", [ConfFile,Cnfs]),
 2086:     {ok,ConfFile}.
 2087: 
 2088: 
 2089: get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, Type) ->
 2090:     {ok,#{preferred_algorithms:=As}} = ssh_system_sup:get_acceptor_options(Pid),
 2091:     proplists:get_value(Type, As).
 2092: 
 2093: test_connection(C) ->
 2094:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 2095:     A = rand:uniform(100),
 2096:     B = rand:uniform(100),
 2097:     A_plus_B = lists:concat([A,"+",B,"."]),
 2098:     Sum = integer_to_binary(A+B),
 2099:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, A_plus_B, infinity),
 2100:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(
 2101:                  {ssh_cm, C, {data, Ch, 0, Sum}} ),
 2102:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_end(C, Ch),
 2103:     ok.
 2104: 
 2105: test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port, Opts) ->
 2106:     try
 2107:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port, Opts)
 2108:     of
 2109:         Cx when is_pid(Cx) -> {error, connected}
 2110:     catch
 2111:         error:{badmatch, {error,_}} -> ok
 2112:     end.
 2113:
